description: Async, please join only if you play during American continental daytime and can do 2+ Moves/Day, it's Alpha and Prototype and can break
title: 1877: Stockholm Tramways

actions.message: Welcome everyone, and thanks for joining, my second try of this title, I look forward to trying it out again
ok, no problem! Need to look at the rules for this one, but excited to try it out

The one thing to watch out for are the rules for takeovers, especially the requirement to have more shares than all others and to make sure the combined company does not have more than six station hexes, two players got tripped by that in our last game
More shares than all others combined that is
Also, because of the double and triple jumps it plays more like a Hutton game
Finally, you don't go bankrupt but can turn into a real pauper
Those are the three things I remember from the first play
hm, there's another little timing wrinkle to acquiring too: either both or none of the companies have performed the ”pay dividends or withhold revenue” step in this operating round.
indeed, good catch

The game plays at a brisk pace and the theme fits with the mechanics, in fact I found it interesting to read the historical notes since you see which companies were in the better neighborhoods, which came first, etc. -- I had no idea that streetcars could be that competitive...
That is interesting! I wouldn't have thought so too, with street cars, but if there was no big alternatives to them at the time, and they appeared relatively quickly, it could make sense.
Bellmaker, this is completely different from the first game, glad I gave it a second shot.

I always look for something novel in a new 18XX, and although there is nothing here that I have not seen before in some other form, the whole does not feel like a clone of other games, good second impression
the first impression was "meh"
last bit of rambling, the theme is definitely well chosen, having a small place as the setting emphasizes the dilemma of how to grow a company without exposing it to mergers
Yeah, I love 18Ireland, with the mergers where sometimes you want them to happen and sometimes you don't... This one seems interesting so far too
Ouch Bellmaker, I see what you are about to do...
@luigicool what is Bellmaker about to do?
Ok, I need to review the log. Lol; how did I get so many trains?? Something acquired something else

Burmer, I acquired your company with LT then I used the treasury to buy and extra train and then I sold the shares making you the president of LT.  In retrospect I underestimated how the double and triple jumps will make LT very valuable, more than I thought, I am still kicking the tires of this interesting 18XX

auto_actions.reason: Bellmaker bought on corporation SNS and is unsecure

actions.message: Sorry yall, i was travelling
No worries

auto_actions.reason: 6 share(s) bought in SF, end condition met

actions.message: GG
GG
It is a good design, I just seen to be quite bad at it 🙂
Or maybe I should say that Bellmaker and LilyG seemed to be much better at it 🙂
